chatroom-jms example

1) Description

This demonstrates a translation of a DDS message to a JMS message using a Bean.

2) Scenario

The demo is based on the simple chatroom example, but the ChatMessage objects are translated into JSON strings and then sent on to ActiveMQ Endpoints where they are printed to the console.

It is necessary to translate a DDS entity before passing it on to a JMS system. This is because the classes generated for a DDS Topic object are not serializable, so there is no way to directly wrap them within a JMS message. Camel's diversity allows us to introduce a Bean class in the route which will translate the object to a format which can be wrapped in a JMS message.

  • In the figure below we see the two routes used in Camel server
  • The sample contains 3 fields :
    • string     userID;     (string type)// owner of message
    • long       index;      (long type)// message number
    • string     content;     (string type)// message body

3) Design

It consists of 2 parts :

  • DDSJMSDemo : a class that create a chat user and defines different routes wich are used through Camel.
  • ChatMessagetoJSONConverterBean : a bean that converts a ChatMessage to a JMS message.

4) Building/Running

Environment Setup

  • Make sure to have Maven executable (mvn) and Java executable in PATH.
  • Make sure to have Vortex OpenSplice environment set (on Linux sourcing Vortex OpenSplice's release.com file).

Building the example:

  • Change directory to examples/chatroom-jms and execute:
    • mvn package

Running the Java example:

  • Start the Vortex OpenSplice services:
    • ospl start
  • Open a command prompt and change directory to examples/chatroom-jms. Enter the following command:
    • mvn exec:java -Dexec.args="user1"
  • Open another command prompt in examples/chatroom-jms directory and enter the following command:
    • mvn exec:java -Dexec.args="user2"
  • Type a message on one of the terminals and hit ENTER. The message will be routed through JMS and appear in the other terminal.

Exiting the demo

  • Type 'quit' and hit ENTER.
